description: Etobicoke is a relaxed area along the Humber River. It's saturated with green spaces and conservatories, making it a premier destination for outdoor sports, hiking, and nature walks. Its abundance of parkland and lakes makes it a typical spot for fishing, picnicking, and camping out, especially in warmer months. The peaceful area is also enjoyed by families, who appreciate its boardwalks and sports facilities. Locals enjoy the variety of golfing and country club opportunities, which also provide lessons for golfers of any skill level.

reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
text: If you are a golfer find another golf course to play. You will thank me. Terrible condition and not maintained well. Piss your money away playing this course. Yes it’s within the city limits however not worth  the money.

reviews.title: Pretty Poor
text: With a number of incredibly similar holes, as well as two silly right angle doglegs, the layout itself is not very impressive. A very flat course. Most greens are pocked with ball marks.

The approaching planes are kind of fun, but the nearby scenery is kind of grim as it features a number fo ugly airport hotels, a noisy cement factory and on the 8th and 9th a chemical plant or something that causes the area to be filled with a horrible smell reminiscent of model glue. (Have noticed this on all 3 of my visits).
So generally speaking, not a great golf experience.
All of this made worse by the $125 green fee - an absolutely ridiculous price for what is on offer here.

reviews.title: Terrible/rude Marshals
text: I wanted to like this place so much, but the behavior of the Marshals were terrible.  Long story short, we booked a tee time for two (with cart) for an early morning tee time.  Upon arrival, we were paired with walkers. These were the only walkers for the morning and were placed in front of several small groups with carts.  We made the best of it and waited for the walkers on the first nine.

About the 7th hole, the marshal told us (specifically is players in the cart) to pick up rate of play.  We explained that we were paired with walkers and they were causing the “delay”.  The marshal never approached the walkers. All groups behind us had carts and were 2-3 players. The marshals then followed us to the 8th-10th holes and watched us play. On the 10th hole the marshals approached us in the cart again and told us to play from the red tees due to rate of play.  They also made a comment about it being a “rough” game.  We completed the front 9 in 2 hours and 11 minutes, even while waiting for walkers, slightly above average for rate of play.  We left after the 10th due to the continued harassment by both marshals.
I would not return again due to this behavior, but I will say that the clubhouse staff were apologetic and receptive to our concerns, especially Roy.

reviews.title: Losing it's luster
text: Played this course twice this year because a friend had discount coupons. The course is poorly maintained. There had been drainage work performed last year and the resurfacing was poorly done. The cart paths remind me of some Toronto roads... very bumpy and under repair. The tee blocks are worn and neglected. The course is in desperate need of upkeep. The best thing about the course is the location which is close to the airport.

reviews.title: Hidden Gem of Toronto Golf Scene
text: Wanted to spend some time relaxing while on business and hopefully close a deal. This gem of a course right under our noses near YYZ was the ticket. With the wives along we.had a great round on a beautiful course that was challenging and gave us a chance on every hole. Plus the bonus of some give and go between me and my  guest while striking a deal. Ladies had a great time. Staff were amazing and lunch afterwards was a treat. Thanks and we'll see you again.

reviews.title: A Royal Treat
text: Wifey and I had a few hours to kill waiting for our flight so we headed over to take in 18.

They outfitted us with clubs balls and a cart. Real friendly and happy to have us. Met up with the starter and he gave us the low down on the course. Completed our foursome with a couple of locals which was good to see.

An amazing course in superb condition. With lots of rain the past few weeks made for an exceptional round. Greens were true. Ebery hole was a different challenge. Having played a lot of prairie golf where many courses run through coulees and canyons this was an unexpected delight in the Toronto area. Every chance we get when in TO we will be back.
Thanks Woodbine and kudoos to your staff.

reviews.title: average at best....
text: We recently played 18 holes at Royal Woodbine. I must say that the course was in really good condition when we played and it can be attributed to the wet spring/summer we had.
It is a tight golf course and for you to shoot a good score, you need to play smart golf, put your drivers away and hit to the 150 yard markers. For those reasons, I just don't like the course.

reviews.title: Too slow
text: Played this course for the second time  in 20yr. Now I remember why. 5 hrs.  To play, greens were very good, rest of the course so-so.

reviews.title: For the novice golfer maybe
text: Constant sound of engines from what seemed every plane leaving the airport. Really interesting for the first few and then it was just deafening. There is a putting green. No driving range. Crazy expensive for this type of course. 2pm-3pm fee was $91.50 plus cart fee of $7.50  If you park in the further part of the parking lot they are selective as to who can drive their cart through the parking lot to their car to unload their clubs. So that was a bit different and unexpected.  Not on my future playlist for sure.

reviews.title: Challenging local golf course
text: Many good and not so good aspects to this course.
Probably the best public course to the west of Toronto within easy reach of the downtown or Etobicoke - but constant plane traffic at low level.
Well kept and with a variety of holes but can be daunting and frustrating for the medium/high handicapper due to the many tight holes, frequency of  water in play  and challenging target positioning.
$70 for the round including cart is not bad for a metro course but again the planes and the industrial surrounds are a drawback.
Would I go back ---- only a maybe.

reviews.title: Not maintained well and poor service
text: This course is like a ride at an amusement park. Planes fly just over your head every 5 minutes causing quite the distraction. Your attention is needed because the water on almost every hole requires excessive target golf (leave your driver at home). You could play this course with your irons.

Several areas under repair, only one beverage cart, and grounds keepers that keep the motors running as you hit, drive over your ball, or stand on the tee box and chat with each other while you try to hit.
Not worth the money, go elsewhere.

reviews.title: Flooded hole ruins NEW golf shoes
text: FIRST time playing the course during the week,there was a tournament.First issue,Royal Woodbine does NOT let you pick up your clubs from your car,or drop them off at YOUR car using their cart.If driving a cart to your car is what you want to do,and can do at other courses,Royal Woodbine will not be accessible,nor convenient.This isn't a course that has valet service,and I don't expect it with such a course.Cart rule was provided to my golf partner,and I by a staff member quoting management.This policy should give pause to those thinking of having a tournament at this location.Having over 100 players driving their cars to the already narrow club drop off area,then driving carts to the same tight area behind the cones to pickup their clubs is inconvenient.Fast forward, post our 18,the same cones BLOCKING carts from entering the parking lot were REMOVED.Players used carts to drop off their clubs to their cars in the parking lot. Second issue,there were holes with obvious sitting water due to the the recent rain in the past week we played.Yet, I was not expecting to step into a shin level, DEEP mud puddle near their irrigation while heading to the fairway.One would hope their course staff would place a flag to warn players.Course GM was notified,nothing was done to rectify the experience. Two stars are given for the FANTASTIC pictures you can get from playing below the Pearson International airport flight path.

reviews.title: Tooney + $1 per hole Special
text: The special attracted me back after 16 years. Still a shotmakers course. Keep it straight, don't gamble and you will score well. Well maintained, good to play in summer holidays when fewer corporate clients. Won't be as long next time

reviews.title: Very nice local track!
text: Played yesterday for the first time. Must say I was very impressed , not only with the remote feeling, but a very nice track. Staff were very attentive , with 16 holes with water ...make sure you bring a few extra balls. Given its right beside the 427, 401 , and on flight path, it wasn't a problem at all.

reviews.title: Best part...centrally located.
text: Royal Woodbine is located near the airport - actually right under the flight path of the jets.  It's not a bad track for someplace that looks like it was originally a flood run-off for the surrounding area.  You are literally below grade from the roads and the nearby buildings.

The place is well kept but I would probably warn you against some of the food.  I ordered a sausage on the go and it was cooked, then nuked, then fried - or any of those in any particular order.  The prepackaged sandwich seems the way to go - ugh!

The rounds can get pretty expensive.  On peak hours - up to around $100.  It's kind of worth it since it is one of a few centrally located tracks.  No real signature holes to point out but 18th is quite the challenge for a par 5 finish.  Lots of distance, traps, water - oh my!
I play this course on a semi regular basis since I have business meetings in the area.  I wouldn't mind getting some new business in the Muskoka areas in the future - wishing on all shooting stars!

reviews.title: Great Golf Course
text: I have to rate this course very good only for one reason. It's probably the best designed public course in the GTA and is maintained to a good standard. Unfortunately the service at the Club House needs improvement. The "back shop" is generally understaffed. The restaurant is not open for breakfast. One gets the impression the course is ran on a "shoestring" and relies on it's excellent location in Toronto's west end. The green fees could be considered reasonable if the Club improved it's service and made what could be a truly great golfing experience.

reviews.title: Give it a try!
text: This is a nice 18 holes course with a unique view. The jet planes landing from nearby Pearson Airport departing or landing add a different element. The course is in great shape. Most fairways are tight with many creeks and ponds. Greens are quick. Not a a lot of holes that the big slice or draw hitter off the tee will like. Some nice challenging "dog legs" and par 3's. The big driver is always tempted to cut a corner or fly some water or rough. Think twice about it ?  Staff are friendly, pro shop prices good and food was good also. There are lots of Hotel choices in the area close to the course. Prices for a round with a cart are ok. I generally only have the opportunity to play this couse once a year and look forward to it.

reviews.title: A Great Challenge
text: Very interesting golf course. Not overly long but really makes you think about what clubs to hit and what shot to play. Great greens and very friendly pro shop and outside staff. I will definitely play it again.

reviews.title: Poor service, awful ambiance - Not a typical golf course
text: I'm a +15 handicapper, play 10-20 rounds/ season and have low expectations of a golf course, but  I left this course very unimpressed with what it had to offer. The starter was an older gentleman that was very rude (who gave off the impression that he did not like his job) and told our group numerous times to stay on the cart path (even before we teed off).

We teed off on a Friday afternoon, and only saw the cart staff twice the entire round. The course was decently maintained however, they enforced a cart path only policy - in which case, it would have been easier to walk the course given the course cart path layout. On every hole, expect a plane to fly overhead every 2-3 minutes if you don't mind the distraction also consider that it makes it difficult to talk to your party as well.

As someone has indicated below, BEGINNERS BEWARE - given that this course is in rural GTA - it's tight, and the designer plugged a creek that runs through every hole as well as has ponds on every few holes (it's largely target golf).

The pro-shop staff & restaurant was small, the staff were fine. Cost was an issue, but I won't be playing here again. The course was not busy, which helped the speed of play, but it was telling that others likely think the same thing. My recommendation is to drive 30 extra minutes to play at a REAL golf course that doesn't have planes landing <2km away.

reviews.title: i really like this golf course
text: friendly pro shop, excellent course, dont get vertigo watching planes fly into airport right over your head !!!!! fireman bill.

reviews.title: Alway Fun To Play
text: Although it is not located in a fancy area and has planes flying overhead every couple of seconds I always enjoy this course.  With water on every hole and the need to draw and fade the ball on almost every tee shot it is a shotmakers delight.  The staff is always friendly and make me feel welcome.  As it is the home base for the NHL Alumni there is always the chance of seeing hockey players that were my hero's when I was a boy.
